emuInput.TitMainTitle: Men, including Ed Link and Dave Luck, gathered around Cadillac car with dead deer and two bears tied to hood, Wylie Avenue, Hill District
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1941, pg. 16, reads: "Ed Link and Dave Luck, Pittsburgh sportsmen, shown with the kill they made recently in northern Canada. They bagged two grizzlies and two deer.  Their loot is shown on the side of the automobile. Friday night at the Crawford Grill this prize catch will be consumed by a host of lovers of wild game.  Sponsored by Gus Greenlee, the big spread will be known as "The Feast of the Nimrods," and is expected to be one of the most unique affairs ever held in Pittsburgh."
